# Ingredients

 - 3 tbsp EVOO, plus more for serving
 - 500g gnocchi
 - 2 tbsp unsalted butter
 - 4 garlic cloves, minced
 - 1/2 cup dry white wine (or broth)
 - Salt
 - Pepper
 - Pinch red-pepper flakes
 - 500g shrimp
 - Lemon juice
 - Parsley, chopped

# Instructions

## 1
 - Take shells off the shrimp
 - Heat 2 tbsp oil, medium heat, nonstick pan
 - Add gnocchi and break up
 - Cook 10-12 minutes, mixing up every 2 minutes, until crispy
 - Transfer gnocchi to a bowl

## 2
 - Add 1 tbsp oil, 2 tbsp butter to pan, medium heat
 - Add garlic, cook 30-60 seconds
 - Add broth/wine, salt, pepper, red pepper flakes
 - Simmer, let broth/wine reduce by half (2 minutes)

## 3
 - Add shrimp until pink (2-3 minutes)

## 4
 - Return gnocchi to pan w/ salt
 - Add lemon zest (if you have it)
 - Add parsley
 - Add water if pan is dry (1 tbsp)
 - Take off heat

## 5
 - Squeeze lemon juice on the gnocchi mix (as much as you'd like)
 - Add more salt/pepper/red pepper flakes if needed
